result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry A. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jerry A. Williams in court.  Attorney Michael C Griesbach in court for Jerry A. Williams. Attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for State of Wisconsin. 
NO CONTEST to the charge in count 1, battery or threat to judge, prosecutor, or law enforcement officer.  Convicted.
Court imposes costs only, total $518.00 due in 60 days or 10 days jail for failure to pay.  DNA sample also ordered.
Plea hearing on October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:22 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jerry A. Williams appeared by video, in custody. at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Michael C Griesbach appeared by video for Jerry A. Williams. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.
